alert.note: Alert for Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 11:50PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Pender County through 1230 AM EDT... At 1149 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a severe thunderstorm over Harrells, or 11 miles west of Wallace, moving east at 30 mph. While the core of this storm will not affect Pender County, strong wind gusts up to 50 mph may occur within a few miles of the Duplin County line. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Penderlea and Willard. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 388 and 390. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
